title: Product Manager - Financial Products
description:
**Juni who?**  

At Juni, we’re busy building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.  

  

**How & why we do it**  

We give our people the same thing we’re building for our customers: freedom. Freedom to be 100% yourself. Freedom to explore your potential and what’s more – make the most of it. We truly believe we’re making the world a better place for online businesses, and we want you to be a part of that mission.

**Your role at a glance ‍️**  

You'll work closely with designers, engineers, specialist stakeholders, and the Product director to develop Banking capabilities and financial products, which form a core part of our platform and value proposition. You will act as the voice of our customers and be a stable bridge between engineering and the business. You will also help the team function as an empowered product team by setting the right product culture and vision, and help the team deliver high quality impactful features.  

  



**Your responsibilities**

In this role, you’ll:

* Product Strategy and Vision: Defining the strategic direction of financial products, aligning them with the company's overall business strategy. This involves creating product roadmaps that outline planned features and enhancements based on customer feedback, competitors, market demands and business priorities.
* Customer Experience: Lead the vision for financial experience within the platform- bank transfer, invoice payment, credit usage etc. Ensure the financial and banking features are chain-linked into cohesive end-to-end workflows. Work with designers to build UX that WoWs customers.
* Financial Product Ecosystem: Unpacking the Swedish banking ecosystem and liaising with regulators, Swedish banks and payment third parties, to unlock new payment rails and banking partnerships. This would require you to attend events, conferences and build a strong network in the payment eco-system. The same will need to be replicated for our other GTM geographies.
* Customer Research: Conduct thorough customer research to understand customer (ICP) needs, market trends, and the competitive landscape in the financial product space. This includes gathering insights through customer interviews, surveys, and data analysis.
* Cross-functional collaboration: Working closely with various departments such as engineering, design, commercial, and finance to ensure effective product development and launch. This includes facilitating communication and alignment among different teams.
* Product Development Oversight: Managing the product backlog, prioritizing features, and working closely with development teams to ensure timely and high-quality delivery of banking products
* Market Positioning and training: Developing strategies for positioning and pricing banking and financial products in the market. Ensuring that the commercial teams have been trained on product features and value propositions clearly understood by all.


Within 1 month you will:

* Understand how Juni’s product teams work
* Be integrated with your team
* Ship your first financial features

Within 3 months you will have:

* Stronghold of your teams' growth metrics
* Deep understanding of your team’s roadmap
* Shipped many features and fix critical bugs

Within 6 months you will:

* Oversee delivery against your metrics and roadmap (with some bumps along the way)
* Set 12-month rolling vision for Banking and Finprod domain
* Actively participate in customer research to understand the voice of customer
* Understand how Juni’s product teams work
* Be integrated with your team
* Ship your first financial features

**Tooling ️**

* Slack
* G-suite
* Notion
* BI tools

**Qualifications**

What we need to see

* Familiarity with fintech and financial services (preferably from Sweden)
* Good understanding of Swedish and global payment eco-system
* 3+ years of product manager experience
* Understanding of payment rails


What we’d love to see

* Familiarity with financial and spend management products (preferably from Sweden)
* 5+ years of overall experience
* Experience with Bankgiro, Rix-inst, Swift, any other payment rails
* Engineering or computer science degree

**Your people**  

Our team is as ambitious as our amazing customers. We aim high and we move with speed to make our vision a reality. We care deeply about building a better future for our customers and each other. Here, you can work with people at the top of their game and who didn’t get there by playing games. You can help us create a whole new category in financial services.

**Your benefits**

We’re freedom-first. Transparent. Caring. Empowering. So our benefits are too.

* **We work hybrid.** We'll see you in one of our offices in Stockholm or Gothenburg at least two days per week.
* **Swap 2D for 3D**. Meet all Junis IRL at the company onsite each year.
* **Diversity is at our core**. We're part Swedish. Part Canadian. Part French. Part Indian. Part Italian. Part British. Part Portuguese. You get the idea.
* **Great players can stay great players**. Progress your career whether you choose to manage people or not.
* **Stock options**. We can’t promise you’ll make a fortune. But we’ll give it our very best shot.
* **Vacation days**. 30 days contractually. Unlimited in policy. Awesome.
* **Private Health insurance**. You know. Just in case
* **Beautiful offices** in central Gothenburg and Stockholm, front row sea view!

title: Product Manager - Growth
description:
**About Mindler**


Mindler was founded in 2018 by two psychologists and a doctor with a shared vision of creating a world with improved mental health. Thanks to our dedicated tech teams, who developed our app and iCBT modules, Mindler has emerged as a leading provider, transforming the mental health industry. Mindler is more than just a workplace—we combine scientific methods with human empathy to create an environment where emotions matter.


Our tech organization is split into three teams: Growth, Treatment and Operational Efficiency. All teams work full-stack across our different applications like the patient app, psychologist web platform and back office systems. In this role you would be working with the Growth team, primarily focusing on improving our user journey and product-led growth.

**The role:**


As Product Manager at Mindler, you’ll report to the VP of Product and ensure that your assigned product area is proceeding efficiently and is aligned with the company's operational and strategic goals. You will work to identify and fill product gaps and drive product development that ensures company growth from a user-centered perspective. You will be part of both the Product team and the Growth tech team.


As a PM for the Growth team you will be responsible for driving initiatives focused on Product-led Growth collaborating closely with marketing, tech and the rest of the product team.


**What you’ll be doing:**

* Lead product development and growth initiatives, owning the KPIs that define your team’s success.
* Continuously analyze the user journeys to remove friction points and create an intuitive and supportive user experience.
* Collaborate with designers, developers, and marketing to turn ideas into user stories and technical requirements.
* Run a data-informed, iterative process to identify problems, validate solutions, and discover new growth opportunities through experimentation.
* Translate direct user insights into actionable improvements that enhance both product value and growth.
* Continuously engage and communicate in cross-departmental teams with key stakeholders to systematically identify and gather business objectives.
* Work with the product team to translate long-term vision into short-term goals, driving progress in the field of mental health.
* Ensure product features are aligned with internal guidelines and mandatory regulatory requirements(patient safety, ISO-27001, etc.).
* Champion a data-informed culture across product and tech, ensuring decisions are evidence-based and measurable.
  

**Who are you?**


We are looking for someone with 3+ years of experience in product or project management, who combines a strong drive and a result-oriented approach with an ability to create structure and clarity in their work. You are naturally curious, eager to stay up to date with industry trends, and skilled at translating these insights into your daily work.


**We think you’ll be a good fit if:**

* You have a growth mindset and get excited about the challenge of using the product as an engine for growth.
* Are comfortable working with product analytics to identify pain points and opportunities within the user journey.
* Have a natural empathy for users and a proven ability to put yourself in their shoes.
* A track record of shipping product improvements that moved key business metrics.
* You have a deep understanding of UX principles with experience in creating intuitive, beautiful and effective product experiences.

An undergraduate degree in a relevant field such as business, engineering, or product development is preferred. Strong communication skills are also essential, and you express yourself fluently in English, both in writing and speech as English is the main language used at Mindler.

**It’s a plus if you have:**

* Experience in a startup or scale-up environment.
* Experience creating high-fidelity designs as well as mockups, prototypes, and visual specifications.
* Experience working on both web and app user journeys.
* Experience with digital health products or medtech.
* Experience leading large-scale web-based projects.

**What can we offer?**


If you thrive on collaborating with talented colleagues in the office, but also appreciate the flexibility to work remotely, we could be a great match. We offer a diverse role that emphasizes work-life balance, including tech-driven social activities to foster creativity and innovation. For example we arrange hack weeks, table tennis tournaments, board game nights, etc. There are also parties and physical well-being activities together with the rest of the organization.


You’ll be surrounded by inspiring colleagues in a dynamic, forward-thinking environment. This gives you the opportunity to contribute to a company on a mission to make a meaningful impact on the global market of improving digital mental healthcare.

**We are looking forward to hearing from you!**

 **What the process will look like:**


Video call with a recruiter to learn more about you – and tell you more about us!


interview with Hiring Manager

  

Case


Case presentation & interview with potential team members

 *Mindler is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to gender, gender identity or expression, national origin, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation or age.*

title: Lead UX Designer
description:
The opportunity ✨
   

  

 Waitwhile is on a mission to eliminate the 1 trillion hours people spend waiting in lines every year. Our industry leading queue management and appointment scheduling platform empowers businesses to streamline their operations and deliver exceptional customer experiences.
   

  

 Waitwhile is trusted by 10,000 companies worldwide and has helped more than 250 million people enjoy a radically better waiting experience at places like IKEA, CHANEL, Costco, Delta Airlines, US Airforce and many more.
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Lead UX Designer** 
 in Stockholm to join our mission to eliminate waiting and improve customer journeys. You'll be joining a fast-paced, rapidly growing technology scale-up with awesome culture and benefits.
   

  

 The Role 💼
   

  

 We’re looking for a Lead UX Designer who can both design and lead. You’ll set the bar for product experience at Waitwhile — rolling up your sleeves on key flows while also helping other designers grow in their craft.
   

  

 This role is a mix of
 **hands-on design, research leadership, and team mentorship** 
 . You’ll guide how we discover user needs, shape our design system, and partner closely with product and engineering to ship work that feels simple and obvious to our users.
   

  

 It’s a great fit if you like switching between strategy and detail — one day running usability tests with enterprise clients, the next day tightening a flow in Figma, the next helping a teammate frame their work for an exec review.
   

  

 We’re building a design culture that is practical, curious, and a little bit obsessive about removing friction from the customer journey. You’ll play a key part in making that happen.
   

  

 What you'll be doing 🚀
   

  

 UX Strategy & Research
   

  

* Lead discovery work: interviews, usability tests, and digging into product data.
* Make sure insights are shared in a way that actually shapes product decisions, not just a research deck that gets filed away.
* Help the team focus on the most important user problems — not just what’s loudest.


 Design Execution & Direction
   

  

* Own design for key features and end-to-end journeys, from rough sketches to polished UI.
* Work closely with engineers so the final product feels as good as the prototype.
* Keep Waitwhile's design system - QI - evolving and make sure accessibility and usability are always part of the process.


 Design Operations & Systems
   

  

* Improve how we review, document, and ship design work so it’s consistent and fast.
* Partner with PMs and Eng leads to align priorities and keep delivery smooth.


 Team leadership & mentorship
   

  

* Coach other designers with regular feedback and support.
* Run critiques and workshops that raise the quality of everyone’s work.
* Be the design perspective in cross-team strategy discussions, OKRs, and planning.


**Experience**
 What skills you need 📖
   

  

* 8+ years in product/UX design with a strong track record of shipped web and mobile products.
* Comfortable running the full design process — from research to prototypes to final handoff.
* Strong portfolio that shows both craft (great UI/UX) and impact (how it moved the business or user experience forward).
* Experienced in B2B or SaaS products.


 Tools & methods
   

  

* Expert in Figma (components, prototyping, design systems), or equivalent.
* Proficient in planning and conducting qualitative and quantitative research.
* Comfortable leading cross-functional meetings, critiques, and workshops.
* Familiarity with front-end basics and ability to partner closely with engineering.


 Leadership Qualities
   

  

* Experience mentoring or guiding other designers.
* Strong communicator who can explain design decisions clearly to both designers and non-designers.
* Comfortable leading workshops, critiques, and cross-team discussions.
* More interested in building alignment than winning arguments.


**Bonus Skills ✨**
* Experience in a fast-growing startup or taking products from 0 → 1.
* Familiarity with tools like Amplitude, Mixpanel, or Looker.
* Service design or complex workflow design experience.
* Curiosity about how AI can improve design or research work.


 Benefits ❤️
   

  

* A high-trust environment where design has a seat at the table.
* The opportunity to shape design culture from the ground up at a fast-growing company with a product used by the world’s biggest brands
* Competitive compensation - including health insurance, ITP pension, bike lease and more - and a strong, stable financial backer.
* Remote-friendly culture, flexible work hours, and strong emphasis on well-being.
* Beautiful bright office on Kungsgatan 32 in central Stockholm

title: Interaktionsdesigner (UX-designer)
description:
Interaktionsdesigner (UX-designer) Nivå 4
   

  

**Om uppdraget**
 Till vår myndighetskund söker vi en erfaren Interaktionsdesigner (UX-designer) för ett längre uppdrag. Uppdraget startar den 1 november 2025 och pågår till och med den 31 oktober 2027.
   

  

 Placeringsort är Göteborg, Visby, Västerås eller Sundbyberg. Distansarbete är tillåtet upp till två dagar per vecka.
   

  

 Kundens IT-avdelning arbetar enligt ramverket SAFe och värdesätter de grundläggande intentionerna i det agila manifestet. Här betonas samarbete, tillit, att lyfta varandra samt att våga testa nya idéer.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som UX-designer kommer du att bidra med användarcentrerad designkompetens i hela utvecklingskedjan – från behovsanalys och användarresor till prototyper, testning och stöd vid implementation. I rollen ingår bland annat att:
   

  

 Driva och facilitera designarbete tillsammans med produktägare, utvecklare, verksamhetsrepresentanter och andra designers.
   

  

 Skapa wireframes, prototyper och designskisser i nära dialog med användare och intressenter.
   

  

 Genomföra och analysera användarintervjuer, användartester och workshops för att säkerställa att lösningarna möter faktiska behov.
   

  

 Säkerställa att designen följer tillgänglighetskrav och etablerade designprinciper.
   

  

 Aktivt delta i SAFe-processer såsom PI-planning, teamdemos och systemdemos.
   

  

**Obligatoriska krav**
 Konsulten ska minst ha följande kompetenser och erfarenheter:
   

  

 Minst 8 års aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet som UX-designer.
   

  

 Minst 2 års aktuell erfarenhet av att arbeta med tillgänglighetsfrågor och WCAG.
   

  

 Minst 2 års aktuell erfarenhet av att tillämpa designsystem.
   

  

 Praktisk erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila ramverk.
   

  

 En UX-designportfölj med konkreta exempel som konsulten medverkat i att utveckla.
   

  

**Meriterande krav**
 Erfarenhet av arbete i offentlig sektor eller reglerade verksamheter.
   

  

 Erfarenhet av att arbeta som utvecklare.
   

  

**Personliga egenskaper**
 Mycket god kommunikativ förmåga på svenska i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Förmåga att förstå och analysera komplexa system och arbetsuppgifter.
   

  

 Mod att ifrågasätta och utmana med nya perspektiv och idéer.
   

  

 God pedagogisk förmåga och förmåga att argumentera för design och användarbehov i olika sammanhang.
   

  

 Förmåga att skapa ett sammanhang av kundinsikter och tekniska förutsättningar.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Uppdraget omfattas av säkerhetsskyddslagstiftningen, vilket innebär att säkerhetsprövning och eventuellt registerkontroll kan komma att krävas.

title: AI Technical Product Manager
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Sinch is on a multi-year journey to responsibly scale AI across Enterprise IT (EIT). We're looking for a Specialist AI Technical Product Manager to take ownership of core AI capabilities as part of the EIT domain to ensure AI is safe, effective, and enterprise-ready.
   

  

 You'll partner closely with our central AI Function (responsible for end-user experience, including agent configuration and design) and act as the bridge to Infrastructure, End-User Support, Security, and other IT teams. You'll define, deliver, and continuously improve the technical products, integrations, and operating model that enable AI at scale.
   

  

 This role is based in Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid) and reports to the VP, Business Operations EIT.
   

  

**Product ownership & strategy**
* Own the product vision, roadmap, and backlog for IT AI capabilities (connectors, LLM services, knowledge ingestion, guardrails, governance tooling).
* Translate business needs into clear Product Requirements Documents (PRDs), epics, and acceptance criteria.
* Balance quality, cost, and latency trade-offs for AI workloads.
* Align with the AI Team to ensure agent experiences are enabled by robust back-end capabilities.


**Integration & connectors (Enterprise IT)**
* Scope, design, and deliver secure AI connectors for enterprise platforms (e.g. Microsoft 365/SharePoint, Slack, Jira/Confluence, SAP, data warehouses).
* Partner with Infra/Networking on performance, resiliency, and disaster recovery for AI services.


**Knowledge & data foundations**
* Lead document classification and taxonomy initiatives.
* Define ingestion, enrichment, and retention standards for enterprise knowledge used by AI.
* Establish data access rules, redaction/DLP policies, and least-privilege models to protect PII and sensitive content.


**LLMOps & safety**
* Define quality metrics (help-desk deflection, first-contact resolution, precision/recall, latency, cost per outcome).
* Run A/B experiments and help establish observability for AI systems (feedback loops, drift detection, hallucination monitoring, content filtering).


**Security, risk & compliance**
* Partner with Security, Legal, and Privacy on policy, DPIAs, data residency, logging, and audit; ensure alignment with ISO 27001, SOC 2, and GDPR.
* Define incident response runbooks for AI features and coordinate with Problem/Change Management.


**Roles, Responsibilities & Operating Model**
* Establish clear Roles & Responsibilities model (RACI) across AI, Enterprise IT, and business units.
* Build enablement for End-User Support (playbooks, knowledge articles, escalation paths), and coordinate training and adoption programs.


**Reporting & success measures**
* Own OKRs and executive reporting for EIT AI (adoption, satisfaction, risk posture, cost/benefit).
* Continuously re-prioritize based on business impact, risk, and feedback.


****REQUIREMENTS****
 We believe you thrive at the intersection of product, platform, and change. You're comfortable diving into the technical details while communicating clearly with diverse stakeholders.
   

  

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or related field (Master's is a plus).
* Experienced in Product Management or Technical Program/Product roles, including a minimum of 3 years delivering AI/ML or data-driven products in enterprise environments.
* Proven track record rolling out transformational capabilities at global scale (multi-region, multi-tenant, regulated environments).
* Hands-on familiarity with LLMs and AI platforms; experience with one or more of OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini, Azure OpenAI, AWS Bedrock. Exposure to Google Agentspace is strongly preferred.
* Practical experience with:
* RAG architectures, embeddings, prompt management, evaluation frameworks, and guardrails.
* Building secure connectors and APIs (REST/GraphQL), eventing, and middleware patterns.
* Cloud platforms (GCP/Azure/AWS), identity and access (Azure AD/Entra, Okta), and secrets management.
* Enterprise IT platforms such as Microsoft 365/SharePoint, Jira/Confluence, Slack.
* Strong grounding in security, privacy, and compliance for AI (DLP, PII handling, retention, audit).
* Comfortable with Agile/Scrum; able to write crisp PRDs and sequence/architecture diagrams.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder skills, with the ability to influence, drive alignment, and lead change across technical and non-technical teams.
* Nice to have: ITIL v4 and cloud certifications (GCP, Azure, AWS).


 Our corporate language is English, please submit your application in
 **English**
****OUR HIRING PROCESS****
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Business Analyst
description: Main responsibilitiesLead the work of gathering requirements from the business and other stakeholders.Together with UX designers make our lending solutions for our customers as seamless as possible.Express Product Backlog in terms of Jira User stories with acceptance criteria and other required details.Plan, prioritize and estimate the work together with the team members, and Product Owner.Define acceptance criteria and execute Business Acceptance tests.RequirementsUniversity degree (preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance or Economics).Proficient in requirements gathering, analysis, and documentation.Strong understanding of software development processes, software architecture layers, API integrations.Experience in agile way of working (preferable Scrum, SAFe frameworks).Experience in working with Jira, Confluence, Figma tools.Business domain knowledge within the Lending area is considered as an advantage.Excellent communication skills and being.

title: Arlo Europe CRM Digital Designer
description:
**Arlo Europe** 
 , part of Verisure, is seeking a talented, creative, passionate
 **CRM Digital** 
**Designer** 
 to be based in
 **Stockholm, Sweden.** 
 The role will be part of the Portfolio team and will directly report into
 **The Head of CRM,** 
 based in France, and will work closely with the
 **Design and Marketing departments.** 




  





**The company’s success depends on its people, and it invests in them every day. Working with Verisure is being part of an industry leading world-class company that has a strong entrepreneurial spirit.** 




  





**About Arlo Europe** 




  





 Arlo Europe, part of Verisure, is a leader in smart home security. We combine cutting-edge camera technology with intelligent services to give millions of families across 49+ countries the clarity, confidence, and peace of mind they deserve.
 



  





 Our mission is clear:
 **to deliver smarter home security that connects, prevents, and protects with intelligence, simplicity, and trust** 
 . Together, with millions of families, we are creating safer, more connected homes everywhere.
 



  





**In 2019, Verisure acquired all rights to Arlo’s European business,** 
 in particular, the exclusive distribution rights for Arlo branded camera products for all sales channels in Europe, including e-commerce and retail. What makes us unique is that Arlo Europe operates as a
 **start-up within a global group** 
 . This means you’ll benefit from a
 **fast-moving, entrepreneurial, and agile environment** 
 , while also enjoying the
 **stability, resources, and career growth opportunities** 
 of a world-class company. It’s the best of both worlds: the excitement of building something new, backed by the strength of an industry leader.
 



  





 At Arlo Europe, you’ll be part of a team where
 **your ideas and impact matter** 
 , and where together we are shaping the future of safer, more connected homes.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




  





 Visual Design for CRM Campaigns
 


* Design email templates, newsletters, and other CRM assets that align with brand guidelines.
* Create graphics, banners, and illustrations for use in email, SMS, and push notifications, and other media
* Ensure designs are optimized for both desktop and mobile formats.



 User Experience in CRM Content
 


* Develop layouts that enhance readability and engagement.
* Apply UX principles to ensure intuitive, customer-friendly designs.
* Maintain visual consistency across all CRM touchpoints.



 Brand Alignment
 


* Ensure all visual elements comply with corporate brand standards.
* Adapt global brand guidelines to local market needs when required.



 Creative Assets Management
 


* Maintain a library of reusable CRM design templates.
* Organize and archive creative assets for easy retrieval.



 Collaboration
 


* Work closely with CRM managers, copywriters, and developers to deliver final campaign creatives.
* Incorporate feedback from stakeholders into design revisions.



 Quality Control
 


* Test visuals across different email clients and devices to ensure accuracy.
* Check image resolution, file size, and load speed for optimal performance.



  





**Location** 




 Permanent hire based in Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid).
 



  





**Reports and organization structure** 




 Direct reporting line into Head of CRM, France
 



  





**Candidate profile** 




  





**Experience and Qualifications** 




 Education
 


* Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, Visual Communication, or a related field (Master’s degree or MBA in Design Management is a plus).
* 3–5 years in a professional design environment (agency, in-house creative team, or product design department).



  





**Competencies:** 




 Technical Skills
 


* Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, XD) and/or Figma, Sketch.
* Strong understanding of branding, typography, color theory, and layout principles.
* Familiarity with UI/UX principles and design system management.



 Nice to have
 


* Experience with any CRM tool (Salesforce, marketing cloud, customer io)



 Soft Skills
 


* Strong creative vision with attention to detail.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and stakeholder management skills.
* Ability to translate business goals into compelling design solutions.
* Strong organizational skills to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
* English fluent, writing and speaking



  





**Strong fit with our Company DNA** 



* Passionate in Everything We Do:
 
 Our people have a sense of energy that is unmistakable, one that drives us to delight our customers and focus on creating impact quickly.
* Committed to Making a Difference:
 
 When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline.
* Always Innovating: We believe that Innovation can be big or small;
 
 it’s a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers and we learn continuously.
* Winning as a Team:
 
 Our people know that by leveraging one another’s strengths, investing in and developing our team’s capability and by collaborating well, we will win.
* With Trust & Responsibility:
 
 Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.



  





**The Company** 




**Diversity & Inclusion** 




 Verisure is an equal opportunities employer. We recognize the richness that diversity brings and encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply. We champion an inclusive and collaborative culture and empower all employees to succeed and grow. Please reach out to us if you have any specific requirements throughout the recruitment process, we are happy to help. At Verisure, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, recognising that diversity of thought and background only makes our teams stronger and more innovative. We reject all forms of discrimination and bias, and we believe in access to opportunities for everyone, regardless of gender, age, disability status, race, sexual orientation, or any other status.
 



  





**We Are People Who Protect People** 




 We are the leading provider of professionally monitored alarms for residential households and small businesses in Europe.
 



  





**Peace of mind for families and small businesses** 




 We believe it is a human right to feel safe and secure. We now protect more than 5 million families and small businesses. Our service includes 24/7 monitoring, expert verification and response, customer care, service and maintenance services, and professional technical support. As well as protecting against intrusion, we protect against fire, attack, theft, life-threatening emergencies and other hazards. Verisure people are dedicated and committed and provide what we believe is the best customer service in the industry.
 



  





**Leading across a broad footprint** 




 We are the leading provider of residential and small business monitored alarms in Europe. We operate in 17 countries across Europe and Latin America. Our business is driven by organic growth, based on our differentiated business model. We attract high quality customers. We work hard to ensure that our customers are happy. This contributes to an industry leading level of attrition and a long customer lifetime.
 



  





**A technology-enabled human services company** 




 Our 26,000 team-mates are the foundation of our company. Our business model combines technology and human expertise to protect people. We are a human services company. More than 80% of our colleagues interact with customers every day. This connection provides the insight that inspires our innovation. These insights are a source of advantage. We leverage these insights with the significant investment we make into product and service innovation. The close customer contact also fuels the pride which drives engagement.
 



  





**35 years of experience – and many more to come** 




 We have been protecting what matters most since 1988. Over that time, we have expanded beyond our roots in the Nordics and Spain. We now serve most of Europe and have also established a strong presence in Latin America. In 2017, to evolve our operating model, strategic innovation, operational excellence and access to talent, we opened our new Group headquarters in Geneva, Switzerland. In 2019, we formed a strategic partnership with Arlo, a world leader in connected cameras. Verisure acquired all rights to Arlo’s European business. This allows us to offer connected camera services in Europe as a complement to our professionally monitored security service. It also allows us to access new go-to-market opportunities in retail and e-commerce.

title: Visual Design Lead
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.**
**The role**
 As a Visual Design Lead at Epidemic Sound, you'll be at the forefront of shaping the
 **visual design and user interface** 
 of our digital products. You'll lead the
 **visual design direction** 
 , defining our
 **design system** 
 ,
 **motion language** 
 , and elevating the user experience across our platforms. This is a role for a
 **hands-on visual designer** 
 who is passionate about the interplay of
 **UI** 
 , content, and motion to create a seamless and impactful experience for our users
   

  

 You'll report to VP Design and join our Experience Design team, a talented group of designers with a passion for creating the world’s best soundtracking platform for creators. You will collaborate closely with other designers, engineers, product managers, and brand and marketing teams, to ensure a cohesive and impactful end-to-end user journey.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities include:**
* Elevate the visual quality of our product by delivering compelling UI design solutions, integrating layout, typography, and motion to enhance user engagemen
* Translate complex concepts into intuitive, cohesive, and high-impact user interfaces, using motion, interaction and visual design to guide attention and improve usability.
* Lead the development of visual and motion systems to ensure consistency, scalability, and a refined user experience across platforms.
* Mentor and support designers across teams, fostering excellence in visual, interaction, and motion design craft.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with product, tech, brand and marketing teams to influence and shape the end-to-end experience with a strong point of view on how it should look, feel, and move.


**Requirements**
* A strong portfolio of innovative and emotionally resonant work, demonstrating your leadership in shaping acclaimed digital products and brand experiences.
* Proven expertise in translating high-level strategy into compelling art direction, and a track record of developing scalable visual and motion design systems.
* In-house, cross-functional experience—proven collaboration with engineering, product, and brand partners.
* Mastery of the modern design toolset, with a particular fluency for prototyping, visual, and motion design.


**Soft Requirements**
* A true collaborator and natural influencer, with a gift for building consensus and inspiring designer peers, teams and stakeholders around a shared creative vision.
* Exceptional storytelling and communication skills, able to articulate the 'why' behind your design decisions to everyone from junior designers to executive leaders.
* A deep-seated passion for mentoring, with a genuine desire to elevate the craft, creativity, and confidence of the designers you work with.
* A balance of strong creative conviction and an empathetic, humble approach, welcoming diverse perspectives to strengthen your design solutions.


**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Ready to make the world
 *feel* 
 your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
   

  

***Welcome to Tune In - our behind-the-scenes video series where we sit down with the brilliant minds shaping the sound and story of Epidemic Sound.***
***n this episode Oscar Höglund, CEO and Co-Founder of Epidemic Sound sits down with Sam Hall, Chief Product Officer where he shares why he fell in love with Epidemic Sound, what the role of a Product Manager at Epidemic Sound entails and learning to lead in a different culture.***
***Thinking about joining us? Tune in - and see if we sound like your kind of vibe.***
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Junior iOS Engineer - Merchant Group
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We are looking for a Mobile Engineer for our iOS team to join our Merchant Group.
   

  

 In this role you would join our New Business division, building brand new products and enabling growth for our new emerging business lines.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing
   

  

**Day-to-day in this role you’ll:**
* You work with multiple different business lines so you have to enjoy learning new things and be comfortable with new code bases.
* You’ll be surrounded by experienced developers who will challenge you, mentor you, and give you the tools to accelerate your growth. If you’re ambitious, open-minded, and excited about building products that people love to use, this is the opportunity to start shaping your career.
* Your role will require an ability to handle ambiguity and rapid changes while maintaining a focus on quality and high performance. This is a unique opportunity to work on new products that will significantly impact how Merchants operate with Wolt.


 Our humble expectations
   

  

* Working with more senior developers in architecting and building key components of modern iOS applications, leveraging both existing technology assets and new tools such as modern Swift, general concurrency principles and Swift native concurrency, unit testing, familiarity with design patterns, Xcode, experience with UIKit.
* Willingness to work and learn in other mobile technologies such as Flutter and React Native with support from Senior colleagues.
* Influence architecture decisions and technology stack selection, and help steer overall product direction.
* Collaborate closely with product, design, and backend teams to shape features and user experiences.
* Implement high-quality, scalable code while maintaining performance and security standards.
* Rapidly iterate and adapt to evolving requirements and ambiguous contexts.
* Continuously refine the app’s user experience to support and enhance merchants’ daily operations.
* Drive innovation and help to establish best practices for the team.


 What we offer
   

  

 We can offer super interesting work and great growth opportunities in greenfield code bases, diverse products and new emerging business lines. You get to shape what Wolt will be in the future!
   

  

 Next steps
   

  

 We’re reviewing applications on a rolling basis, and the role will be filled as soon as we find the right person—so don’t wait!
   

  

 The hiring process typically includes a conversation with the Talent Acquisition Partner, followed by technical interviews, a team chat, and a final decision.
   

  

 For questions, feel free to contact Aakaanksha Pandey, Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner, at aakaanksha.pandey@wolt.com.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Product Analyst, Mobility Vertical
description:
**THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELL**
**You?** 
 You are an experienced product analyst with e-commerce, digital product, or marketplace background, bringing strong skills in SQL, modern data stacks, behavioural analysis, and experimentation.
   

  

**Role** 
 ? You will empower the Product teams to make data-driven decisions and drive product development through insights, instrumentation and experimentation.
   

  

**Tech stack?**
* Essential skills: Our tech stack includes Snowflake SQL, Tableau, and Amplitude. Equivalent experience with tools such as Power BI or Google Analytics is equally valuable.
* Bonus skills/experience: A/B testing, dbt, Python, Kafka, Data Mesh principles, Machine Learning, Google Slides.


**Location?** 
 Work hybrid, spending a few days a week at our modern offices in Stockholm, Oslo, or Aarhus to promote team collaboration. Prefer an office environment? You’re welcome to join us daily.
   

  

**Company?** 
 Vend is home to leading and loved marketplace brands across the Nordics — Tori, Oikotie, and Autovex in Finland; FINN and Nettbil in Norway; Blocket, Bytbil, and Wheelaway in Sweden; and DBA & Bilbasen in Denmark. Every day, millions of people across the region turn to our platforms to find what they need — whether it’s a job, a home, a way to move, or a fresh start. Together, our users generate billions of behavioural data points, which creates a unique opportunity to work with incredibly rich data sets while shaping the future of how people buy and sell cars, boats, and motorcycles. Currently, we’re in a historic change, consolidating to a common marketplace platform across the Nordics.
   

  

**The team?** 
 You will join the Mobility Insight & Analytics team: six product and business analysts and one data scientist, based across the Nordics. We support product teams and business stakeholders within the Mobility vertical i.e., Cars, Boats and Motorcycles. We collaborate closely with data platform teams e.g. Data and Analytics Engineers, and horizontal Insight & Analytics team.
   

  

**Why us?** 
 In this role, you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact by working with vast amounts of data from across the Nordics. Our marketplaces generate billions of behavioural data points each month, giving you the chance to uncover patterns, guide decision-making, and shape the future of digital Mobility experiences. We hold strong, unique positions across all our segments in the Nordics. Specifically, the Mobility vertical is driving transformation in electrification and the online buying experience, creating a dynamic environment full of opportunities. At our core, we unite across countries, brands, and teams, embracing a culture where we dare to speak up, challenge the status quo, and try new things. We take pride in delivering on our promises and turning bold ideas into real impact.
   

  

 Sounds like your cup of tea? Check out the details below!
   

  

**WHO ARE YOU?**
* You bring 5+ years of experience as a product analyst in e-commerce, digital product or marketplace companies.
* You have experience working with modern data stacks, behavioural analysis and experimentation.
* You are highly skilled in SQL and have an understanding and interest in the whole data value chain, especially from modelling business logic on prepared data to delivering and presenting impactful insights for stakeholders.
* You thrive in a fast-changing environment, balancing the need to maintain high data quality with the curiosity to dig deeper and uncover the bigger picture.
* Acting as the link between technical and business stakeholders comes naturally to you. You build strong relationships with colleagues and stakeholders, and value collaboration and shared success.
* You communicate data and insights in an engaging and visual way and switch between details and overviews to navigate complex business landscapes. You are able to explain data clearly at all levels.
* You turn vast data into actionable insights, elevating our understanding of marketplace user behaviour.
* You’re motivated by the opportunity to evolve alongside a company — and an industry — that’s constantly moving.
* A passion for cars, boats, or motorcycles is a plus.


**WHAT'S THE JOB LIKE?**
* Analyze and translate user behavior and product performance into actionable insights using product analytics tools.
* Act as an enabler for product teams across the Mobility vertical: advise on hypotheses, identify data and tracking needs, define KPIs, and ensure insights drive real impact.
* Help set up and analyze experiments to support data-informed product development.
* Ensure we maintain high data quality while contributing to continuous product evolution.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (developers, product managers, UX, data engineers) as well as other analysts across the Nordics.
* Stay up to date on product development and analytics methods.


**What We Offer**
 At Vend, we offer a range of benefits designed to support your well-being, professional growth and work-life balance. Note that specific benefits may vary by office location.
   

  

* Learning & Development: Access to Vend Learning Lab, external courses, conferences, Hackdays, and leadership development programs.
* Health & Wellbeing: Comprehensive health insurance, mental health support, and other well being.
* Parental Leave: Enhanced parental leave benefits
* Pension & Insurance: Defined contribution pension plans and extensive insurance coverage, including accident, critical illness, and travel insurance.
* Food & Social Activities: Subsidized healthy meals, barista coffee, and various social events like after-work, gatherings, holiday parties, and family activities.
* Employee Share Saving Plan: Opportunity to buy shares with additional complimentary shares after two years.
* Home Office Support: Office equipment for home office setup.


**GOT YOUR ATTENTION?**
 We will review the applications
 **on rolling basis** 
 so apply as soon as possible, where you can share knowledge, learn, grow and make a difference. We value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds. Inclusion for us means creating a fair workspace where each of us is respected, celebrated for who we are, and given equal opportunities to thrive. Application deadline for this role is
 **1st October 2025**

title: Senior UX Researcher | Candy Crush Soda Saga
description:
**Craft:**
 UX & UI
   

  

**Job Description:**
 Do you want to champion the player voice and create memorable gaming experiences for millions of players worldwide? Are you experienced in several research methods and interested in a role with a lot of variety on a fantastic tight-knit team?
   

  

 We are looking for a proactive
 **Senior UX Researcher** 
 with a solid expertise in mixed methods . You will work within the Candy Crush Soda game team, giving a voice to millions of players from around the world by leading the effort of turning hard data into compelling stories, help craft the flow of our games/products, and be in the thick of team efforts to build great player experiences.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Design and lead mixed-methods research studies, including surveys, interviews, focus groups, usability testing, and other appropriate methodologies to address research questions.
* Collaborate with product, design and data scientists to define research objectives, identify research needs, and prioritize projects.
* Develop and maintain a deep understanding of our players, their behaviors, motivations, and needs, and use these insights to improve our players' experience with the game. Ensure that the player perspective is heard and acted upon in the King game design process.
* Translate research findings into actionable and impactful insights and recommendations, and effectively communicate them to the team.
* Establish, improve and promote UX research best practices and processes, and advocate for the role of research in the game team.
* Mentor and support more junior UX researchers, fostering a culture of curiosity, collaboration, and continuous learning within King.
* Stay current with the latest UX research trends, tools, and methodologies, and proactively explore opportunities to incorporate new approaches into our research practice.
* Use inclusive design methodologies, ensuring that we deliver experiences everybody can have access to.


 Skills to create thrills
   

  

* Extensive experience in user research, preferably in the gaming or mobile app industry.
* Expertise in a wide range of quantitative and qualitative research methods, with a proven ability to select and apply the appropriate methodology to address specific research questions.
* Experience in translating a player's insight into impactful features in game.
* Familiarity with testing tools such as UserTesting, PlaytestCloud,etc.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to synthesize complex data and draw meaningful conclusions.
* Proficiency in the research lifecycle, including: briefing, recruitment, questionnaire/discussion guide design, analysis, synthesis of findings, communication of insights.


**About King**
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.

title: First-Line Support
description:
**About The Position**
 We are growing rapidly – transitioning from startup to scaleup – and expanding our footprint across the Nordics and Europe. Our clients range from some of Europe’s largest banks and iGaming companies to smaller, disruptive players.
   

  

 We are now looking for a skilled and service-minded
 **First-Line Support** 
 to join our IT team. This is not a junior role – we’re looking for someone with a solid foundation in support work who thrives in the space between IT and customer care. You’ll be the first line of contact for incoming technical questions, and a key player in helping customers and users – external – to resolve issues effectively and professionally.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As First-Line Support, you will:
   

  

* Respond to customer inquiries and technical issues with professionalism and clarity in accordance with customer SLAs
* Perform basic troubleshooting of software, connectivity, system-related issues, web applications, iframes, JSON APIs, and hardware
* Log, track and document issues, including all steps taken and final resolutions
* Escalate complex issues to the appropriate team members while maintaining ownership of the ticket
* Help build and improve internal documentation and knowledge bases
* Contribute to continuous improvement of support workflows and processes
* Ensure a great user experience, even in high-pressure or sensitive situations


**Who You Are**
 You are a calm, solution-oriented professional with a genuine interest in both tech and people. You thrive in a fast-paced environment where adaptability and communication are key.
   

  

**We Believe You Bring**
* A diploma or degree in IT, Computer Science or similar field
* +2 years of experience in a first-line or technical support role
* Proven ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical users
* Strong troubleshooting skills and service mindset
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written
* Experience with standard IT tools and environments
* Experience providing technical support for web-based applications, including iframe integrations and JSON-based APIs
* A structured approach and the ability to prioritize when everything feels urgent


**Meritorious Skills**
* Experience in Open Banking/PSD2
* Experience with Jira Service Desk, Linear and Slack (Our support plattforms)


**What Kreditz Can Offer**
* Growth Journey: A unique chance to be part of a rapidly growing scaleup where every team member plays a crucial role in the company's success.
* Inclusive Culture: Join a diverse, fun-loving, and collaborative team that celebrates both big and small milestones together.
* Wellness Perks: 24/7 access to an on-site gym, sauna, and sports center, plus a wellness allowance.
* Medical insurance: Quick access to professional medical advice and care
* Compensation: Fixed salary


**APPOINTMENT OF ROL** 
**E**
 As soon as possible
   

  

**SCOPE**
 Full-time, permanent position (tillsvidareanställning)
   

  

**SALARY**
 Fixed monthly salary
   

  

**REPORTING**
 You will be reporting to the company's IT Manager
   

  

**Workplace**
 Danderyd, Stockholm (on-site)
   

  

**CRIMINAL RECORDS EXTRACT**
 As part of our recruitment process we will ask you to present a clean criminal records extract
   

  

**RECRUITMENT PROCESS**
 We interview candidates on an ongoing basis (ongoing selection)
   

  

**CONTACT**
 Lorenzo Puccio, COO, lorenzo@kreditz.com

title: Frontend Engineer - Data Collections Team
description:
**Frontend Engineer – Data Collection Team**
**THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELL**
**You?**
 Skilled in TypeScript and JavaScript with a strong functional programming mindset and a passion for product development. You value sustainable technology, enjoy cross-functional collaboration, and want to contribute to the circular economy.
   

  

**Role?**
 Frontend Engineer to lead our
 **JS SDK Engineering** 
 side. You’ll be at the heart of a project that serves hundreds of thousands of users across some of the most popular Nordic marketplace brands.
   

  

**Tech stack?**
 TypeScript and JavaScript, Shell Scripting, AWS environment (like S3) and good to have
 **Kotlin** 
 and
 **Python** 
 concepts used in backend systems.
   

  

**Location?**
 Hybrid with expectation to be at one of the Oslo, Stockholm offices 2-3 days a week.
   

  

**Company?**
 Vend Marketplaces powers beloved digital brands across the Nordics. We’re building the Next Generation Marketplace, a unified platform driving our verticals: Recommerce, Jobs, Mobility, and Real Estate.
   

  

**Why us?**
 We’re part of Vend’s
 **Data Platform** 
 , the central hub called PTX Core that powers our understanding of users and their interactions. By collecting and analyzing behavioral data, we give our teams the insight to deliver outstanding services and launch precisely targeted campaigns.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Own the JavaScript SDK project used across Vend applications to track user behavior.
* Make key technical decisions and own the deployment process for our products.
* Design and refine frontend utilities that make our SDK intuitive and effortless for internal teams to use.
* Communicate directly with the SDK users, reacting to the gathered feedback and implementing improvements.
* Collaborate closely with backend engineers to ensure a consistent approach to new features and updates.


**WHO ARE YOU?**
* Minimum 3 + years working in Frontend Technologies
* Deep expertise in TypeScript and JavaScript, with the confidence to lead development in a dedicated framework.
* Strong skills in Shell scripting and deployment processes.
* Experience contributing to AWS services (e.g. S3).
* Bonus points for understanding Python and Kotlin concepts used in backend systems


**INTERESTED? APPLY NOW** 
 We’d love to hear from you by the
 **19th September 2025** 
 . We will start processing the applications after the
 **4th of September 2025.**
**Questions?**
**Piotr Dąbrowski,** 
 Engineering Manager (piotr.dabrowski@vend.com) for Data Collections is happy to answer any question you have regarding the role and you can reach out to
 **Clayton Don Corda,** 
 Senior TA Partner (clayton.don.corda@vend.com) regarding the process

title: Product Lead - Platform and Integrations
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin and Bird & Bird. Backed by over $110M in funding from top investors including ICONIQ, General Catalyst, Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, Slack, and top tier consulting and law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 As a
 **Product Lead** 
 for our Platform and Integrations team, you will be at the heart of our technical foundation and core functionality, owning and shaping the infrastructure, interfaces, and enterprise-grade features that power our applications and innovative products.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Lead the end-to-end product lifecycle for integrations and enterprise-oriented initiatives, from discovery through launch to iteration, ensuring features meet customer needs and our technical and product standards.
* Engage directly with enterprise customers and technology partners (CIOs, Legal Ops teams, IT admins, and Security Leads) to understand integration, compliance, and document management requirements, and translate these into actionable features and roadmaps.
* Define and deliver integrations with leading enterprise software and vendors, including identity providers (SSO/SCIM), document management systems, productivity suites, e-signature platforms, and security/compliance tools.
* Collaborate closely with backend, infrastructure, and integrations engineers to design APIs, data flows, and architecture that enable seamless interoperability across external systems.
* Drive the product vision and roadmap for enterprise features, including secure document handling, user and role management, admin tooling, permissions, audit logs, and cross-system integrations.
* Translate engineering and enterprise user requirements into clear, prioritized roadmaps that balance scalability, compliance, and usability.
* Navigate trade-offs between technical debt, performance, partner requirements, and product velocity to ensure sustainable evolution of the platform.
* Define and track success metrics related to integration adoption, system reliability, document processing efficiency, and admin usability.
* Act as a liaison between engineering, customer-facing teams, and external technology partners to ensure our integrations and enterprise features align with broader business and compliance goals.


* Stay current on emerging technologies and best practices in SaaS integrations, enterprise ecosystems, and data/document management to inform strategic decisions.


 Who you are
   

  

* You come from an engineering background—preferably with hands-on experience in integrations, backend, or infrastructure engineering.
* You have a proven track record of delivering integrations with third-party software and technology vendors, translating both partner requirements and customer needs into compelling enterprise roadmaps.
* You excel at communicating complex technical concepts to diverse audiences, from executives to end-users, and can translate customer and partner needs into clear requirements.
* Comfortable working across distributed systems, APIs, identity and access management, document/data pipelines, and SaaS ecosystems.
* Strategic yet customer-aware: you balance long-term enterprise needs with immediate product initiatives.
* Autonomous, proactive, and thrive in fast-paced, high-ownership environments.


 What's in it for you
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve. We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Clinical Validation Specialist
description:
*RaySearch develops innovative software solutions to improve cancer care. About 1000 clinics in more than 40 countries use RaySearch software to improve treatments and quality of life for patients. RaySearch was founded in 2000 and is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. The headquarters is located in Stockholm, with subsidiaries in the US, Europe and Asia - Pacific. Today we are more than 400 employees with a common vision of improving cancer care with innovative software. Our great staff is crucial for our success and we offer a fantastic working environment in modern offices, flexibility and good opportunities for development. We believe in equal opportunities, value diversity and work actively to prevent discrimination.*
 RaySearch develops a suite of cancer care software, and we are now looking to add more talented employees to our oncology information system RayCare, specifically to our treatment integration team which is responsible for the development of integrations with third-party treatment delivery devices.
   

  

**About RayCare**
 RayCare is a client-server application that runs on premises at many clinics all over the world. RayCare takes care of and helps clinical staff to coordinate their work at the clinic. For example, workflow management, patient chart details and treatment management. RayCare is an innovative oncology information system (OIS) designed to support the complex challenges of modern oncology clinics. It is developed to streamline workflows in cancer clinics to facilitate efficient care faster to more patients. RayCare is used by all staff at the clinic, e.g., physicians, physicists, treatment planners etc. and is used in all steps of patient care, from registration to radiation treatment at the treatment machine and for treatment follow-up. RayCare is integrated with RayStation and its treatment tools but also with external products and supports communication via HL7 as well as DICOM.
   

  

 In the Treatment Integrations team, you will validate and provide feedback on RayCare's integrations with external third-party treatment delivery devices. As part of the Treatment Integrations team, you will have the opportunity to work on a crucial part of the system while gaining insights into various treatment devices, their capabilities, and their integration. Collaborating with talented colleagues, you will contribute to creating high-quality, reliable, and safe integrations.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a Clinical Validation Specialist, you will work closely with integration developers and treatment device vendors and play a key role in ensuring the clinical accuracy, safety, and usability of RayCare’s integrations with third-party treatment delivery devices. You will verify that the software meets requirements and validate clinical workflows, ensuring it aligns with real-world clinical use cases. You will also help identify potential gaps in functionality or safety. Working as part of the treatment integration development team, you will design and execute test cases using treatment simulators and onsite devices, analyze results, provide actionable feedback, and report deviations.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You have a keen eye for detail and a methodical approach, enabling you to evaluate complex clinical workflows and ensure their accurate representation in software, identify discrepancies and assess the real-world impact of proposed solutions. You have knowledge of the treatment planning workflow and its effect on treatment course design and delivery. By taking ownership of your work, you ensure that every aspect of the clinical verification and validation process is thoroughly executed from test design to reporting results. You value collaboration and share clinical insights to improve the different treatment integrations.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Master’s degree in Medical Physics or equivalent.
* Experience with medical software and integration testing in a medical software setting.
* Clinical experience in Radiotherapy and treatment delivery including Oncology Information Systems and Treatment Planning Systems (at least 2 years).
* Experience working with radiotherapy treatment delivery devices .
* Ability to travel to different locations for onsite validation and testing with vendors and clinical users.
* Detailed oriented and strong problem-solving skills.
* Excellent interpersonal skills and fluent English, both in written and spoken.
* Ability to work independently and take initiative when performing validations in clinical settings.
* Analyze complex workflows and define test cases.


**Our Culture**
 Culture at RaySeach is the driving force behind our organization, where everything we do is driven by a shared passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our dedication is reflected in our ability to deliver exceptional results, pay close attention to detail, and consistently go the extra mile. Our employees stand out as experts in their field, driven by a relentless focus on solving problems -no matter how complex. At RaySearch, we take pride in leading the way in cancer treatment, leveraging cutting-edge technology to develop innovative solutions that make a real difference in patient care.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 At RaySearch, we offer a diverse and inclusive work environment, fostering openness, sincerity, and collaboration. Located in Hagastaden, Stockholm's Life Science Hub, our modern and creative workspace includes an in-house gym, yoga, and social activities like ping pong, table football, and regular after-work events. Our bistro serves a fantastic lunch buffet, and we offer morning- and afternoon-fika every day. Our rooftop terrace also provides a stunning 360-degree view of Stockholm, enhancing the work experience. All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package.
   

  

**Application**
 Please apply to the position through the application form below. We do not accept applications by e-mail. Selection and interviews will be ongoing.

title: AI Engineer med inriktning ledningsstödsystem
description:
**Myndigheten för samhällsskydd och beredskap**
 MSB arbetar för ett säkrare samhälle i en föränderlig värld med fokus på utveckling av det civila försvaret. Vi stärker Sveriges förmåga att fungera i kris och till och med krig. Det betyder att alla våra medarbetare bidrar till beredskap och motståndskraft. Från norr till söder sprider vi kunskap och agerar för att skydda liv och hälsa, samhällets funktionalitet och grundläggande värden som demokrati, rättssäkerhet och mänskliga rättigheter. Den 1 januari byter vi namn till Myndigheten för civilt försvar .
   

  

 Vill du tillsammans med oss stärka samhället i att förebygga och hantera olyckor, kriser och konsekvenser av krig? Då kanske du är vår nästa kollega!
   

  

 Som AI-Engineer kommer du att arbeta med utveckling och produktionssättning av maskininlärningslösningar för de ledningsstödsystem myndigheten ansvarar för. Du kommer vara en del av teamet på enheten för tjänsteutveckling. Hos oss får du möjligheten att göra andra beredda att hantera kriser och krig.
   

  

**Ditt ansvar och dina arbetsuppgifter**
 I rollen som AI Engineer kommer du att arbeta med hela kedjan – från design och utveckling av AI-baserade lösningar till drift och optimering i produktion. Beroende på behov kan det handla om att implementera NLP, LLM, generativ AI, computer vision eller reinforcement learning, liksom att bygga system för retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), chattbotar eller rekommendationslösningar. Du kommer att integrera AI-modeller i applikationer via API:er, finjustera färdiga modeller och optimera prestanda utifrån latens, kostnad och resursanvändning.
   

  

 En viktig del av arbetet är att sätta upp pipelines för datainsamling, preprocessing och deployment samt säkerställa att modellerna fungerar tillförlitligt i drift genom kontinuerlig monitorering (t.ex. kring bias, hallucinationer och data drift). Du kommer att samarbeta nära tjänsteägare, produktägare och UX-designers för att skapa AI-drivna användarupplevelser som är både värdeskapande och användarvänliga. Rollen innebär också ett ansvar för att säkerställa att lösningarna följer gällande etiska och regulatoriska ramar, inklusive GDPR, säkerhet och rättvis AI-användning.
   

  

**Dina kunskaper och kompetenser**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av programmering i Python samt kunskap om maskininlärningsramverk som PyTorch och TensorFlow.
* Kunskap om datahantering i Python, ML-metodik, testning och versionshantering.
* Erfarenhet av API-utveckling.
* Erfarenhet av att bygga och använda pipelines för ML (Machine Learning).
* Kunskap inom DevOps.
* Kunskap inom databasteknik.
* Kunskap inom cloud services.
* Grundläggande kunskap inom webbutveckling.
* Erfarenhet av Quality Assurance för test och validering av lösningar.
* Grundläggande erfarenhet av CI/CD och MLOps.


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet inom krisberedskap och civilt försvar.
* Erfarenhet från telekomsektorn.
* Arbetat med utveckling av AI-on prem lösningar.


 Som alla medarbetare och ledare hos oss förväntas du kunna arbeta uppdragsorienterat, utvecklingsinriktat, dialoginriktat, ha god självkännedom och bidra genom att vara ett föredöme.
   

  

**Om anställningen**
 Vi erbjuder dig en anställning tillsvidare på heltid som inleds med en provanställning.
   

  

 Din placeringsort kommer att vara Stockholm och resor i anställningen förekommer.
   

  

 Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav för anställning på MSB då den innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. För anställning krävs godkänt resultat i säkerhetsprövningen med registerkontroll, som genomförs i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Enheten för tjänsteutvecklings uppgift är innovation och utveckling av tjänster samt att
   

  

 kontinuerligt arbeta med att förbättra tjänster inom samhällsviktiga
   

  

 kommunikationstjänster.
   

  

 Vi har aktivitetsbaserat kontor där du kan välja arbetsplats efter egna behov. Du har också möjlighet att arbeta på distans. Vi erbjuder dig också en möjlighet att ta ut friskvårdstimme och du får även ett friskvårdsbidrag. För dig som statligt anställd finns också förmånliga semestervillkor.
   

  

 Alla vi som arbetar på MSB förväntas och ska bidra till ökad jämställdhet och likabehandling för en arbetsmiljö och ett samhälle fritt från diskriminering.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Jon Gustafsson. Fackliga företrädare är Carl Önne (Saco-S), Jan Herremo (ST) och Ann-Britt Paradis eller Leif Fröhlen (SEKO). Samtliga nås via växelnumret 0771-240 240.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 12 september 2025.**
**Anställningsform** 
 Tillsvidareanställning
   

  

**Anställningens omfattning** 
 Heltid
   

  

**Tillträde** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

**Löneform** 
 Månadslön
   

  

**Antal lediga befattningar** 
 1
   

  

**Sysselsättningsgrad** 
 100%
   

  

**Ort** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Län** 
 Stockholms län
   

  

**Land** 
 Sverige
   

  

**Referensnummer** 
 2025/207
   

  

**Publicerat** 
 2025-09-02
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag** 
 2025-09-12
